info.title: interests
info.description:
This [system](http://connections/issite/iCAF/SitePages/Home.aspx) API is used to get detailed information concerning the client's interests.

#### Service Functionality
An interest is a business relationship between the client and a policy (contract), such as the _owner_, _annuitant_, the _insured_ or the _driver_.

The API uses the internal record-keeping system identifier (`clientId`) to locate the client information.  Additionally, one OR more filters MAY be added to the query to describe the desired relationship. This allows the consumer to narrow the request, filtered by the businessObject, _e.g._ `CLM`, `MEMB`, `LIFE` etc. The returned resource will then contain a specific collection of interests tied to the requested businessObject(s).

`.../EnterpriseClientInterestsApi/interests/?clientId=SOME_CLIENT_ID`

get.description: Given the recordkeeping client identifier and filter criteria, provide the collection of intersts which satisfy the query.

schema.description:
An object which relates two objects via type and id.  Consider two objects, such as Policy and Client.  A policy is owned by a client.  In this case, the root objectType is Policy, with it's policyId. The child objectType is Client, with it's clientId.  The relationshipType is owner:  Policy --> Owner --> Client.  

Note that codes or a text description may be used to represent the three parts (root, child, relationship) of the Interest.  In all three cases, either a type (string) or typeCode (string) is required.

rootId.description: The id of the source object.

rootType.description: The type of the root object.

rootTypeCode.description: The type code of the root object.

rootTypeDescription.description: A descriptive tag used with the root object type.

childId.description: The id of the target object

childType.description: The type of the target object.

childTypeCode.description: The type code of the target object.

childTypeDescription.description: A descriptive tag used with the child object type.

relationshipType.description: The relationship between the root and target object.

relationshipTypeCode.description: The code for the relationship between the root and target object.

address.description: Address model--common model to describe the US Postal Service location.

addressId.description: The Enterprise-wide handle to this individual-address entry.

correlationId.description: An arbitrary id which is used to link two objects which are to be considered identical, based on the lexical rule of equivalence for that class of object.

addressType.description: Type code for type of individual address association in Exceed.

associatedObject.description: The object (Policy, Account, Claim, etc) associated with this individual address.

addressStatus.description: The status of the address in the record keeping system.

addressValidationCode.description: The code provided by the source system that indicates the validation status of the address.

addressAggregate.description: The aggregate address for use when the individual components are not known.

street1.description: First line of the postal address, e.g. 100 Main St.

street2.description: Second line of the postal address, e.g. Unit 100.

countyCode.description: The encoded value for the county.

townshipCode.description: The encoded value for the township.

postalCode.description: The USPS postal code, also known as the zip code.  Should be in the format ##### or #####-#### (zip plus four).
